If you would like to learn more about the game you can visit our website at <color=#148ADE><link="https://lastepoch.com">lastepoch.com</link></color>
To join our awesome community please visit the <color=#148ADE><link="https://forum.lastepoch.com">forums</link></color> or our Discord server at <color=#148ADE><link="https://discord.gg/lastepoch">https://discord.gg/lastepoch</link></color>

Character_Mastery_Notice: Mastery Class is chosen during the campaign
Class_Description_Sentinel: Strong in honor and fearsome in combat, the Sentinel stands stalwart against what is unjust even at the end of the world.
Mastery_Description_Sentinel_Void_Knight: A sentinel who has taken part of the Void inside himself and uses it to devastate his foes. His swings leave trails of Void that eagerly consume the essence of his enemies, darkness eating them away from the inside out.
Mastery_Description_Sentinel_Forge_Guard: Skill, strength, steel, and the knowledge his training will prevail. His strikes are surer than hope, and his armor is stronger than despair a bulwark of steel whose mastery of weapons, armor, and molten metal dominates the battlefield.
Mastery_Description_Sentinel_Paladin: Where a blow would strike him down, the light within rises; when his allies would cower, this light gives him the ability to lead. A righteous warrior focused on empowering and healing his allies who can take down swaths of enemies with holy fire.
Class_Description_Acolyte: A rebellious scion who disobeyed her masters and sought out forbidden magic, the Acolyte will let nothing stop her from becoming more powerful.
Mastery_Description_Acolyte_Necromancer: Flesh, bone, blood, and the lingering essence left in life’s wake; these are her tools, her weapons. She is the master of a forsaken army, her dark creations swarming her foes with the hunger of the dead. A hunger borne from her power and fed at her command.
Mastery_Description_Acolyte_Lich: An acolyte who has embraced the corruptive nature of her power and uses the magic of blood and death at the expense of her own Health. Stealing life, consuming the essence of the dead and the damned for strength. This power will make her invincible.
Mastery_Description_Acolyte_Warlock: A master of the forbidden arts, they rend the spirits of their foes with relentless curses and corrupting flames
Class_Description_Mage: An Elder cresting his prime, the Mage wields the power of the arcane to make up for his past wrongs and to give the world a new future.
Mastery_Description_Mage_Sorcerer: A master of the arcane who wields unprecedented power to devastate his foes from a distance. Unearthly lightning erupts from his fingertips, flaming meteors rain from the heavens by his will, the very fabric of reality reshapes itself in his presence.
Mastery_Description_Mage_Spellblade: A mage who has mixed martial prowess with their mastery of spells to face enemies in close range. A sword coated in ice and flame, a shield gleaming with wards. The Spellblade is as brilliant as he is deadly.
Mastery_Description_Mage_Runemaster: An apex among their peers, Runemasters are mages who take the study of runes to the next level. Tapping into the arcane within a rune's construction, they can alter the flow of magic and even combine runes to create spells of which this world has never seen.
Class_Description_Primalist: A warrior from the north who has seen the horrors of war first hand, the Primalist seeks communion with the power of Eterra, the power of nature itself.
Mastery_Description_Primalist_Shaman: The world remembers winds that rage and tear down forests, avalanches that shatter mountainsides, lightning that cracks the sky open and demands awe. A living storm that uses nature's fury to destroy his enemies with the aid of sacred totems
Mastery_Description_Primalist_Druid: A conduit for the long-dormant power of Eterra, he bends the fury of nature to his will even as he takes the form of ferocious creatures. He is an avatar of the earth's latent power, Eterra's bastion against all that would threaten her.
Mastery_Description_Primalist_Beastmaste: A warrior who takes command with the might of beasts, leading by example with strength and power. He charges forward, the ferocity of his companions infusing his body - the heart of the wild beats within him. Fury leading his way.
Class_Description_Rogue: Unrivaled in bow and blade, the Rogue strikes out from the shadows to find a higher purpose for her deadly talents.
Mastery_Description_Rogue_Bladedancer: An artisan of shadows, she dashes out of the reach of her enemies, each movement another deadly cut. Her blade finds its target, and the next, again and again, they fall. She dodges their strikes and makes them pay dearly for it. She dances and kills.
Mastery_Description_Rogue_Marksman: One arrow pierces through a heart and shatters a skull behind it - the next arrow jolts from her bow, sparks crackling in its path. The arrows break one body, then another, and another, a dozen dead - still, more come. She has enough arrows for them all.
Mastery_Description_Rogue_Falconer: Never fight alone. Never fight fair. A master tactician who employs deceptive traps and the aid of a fearsome bird of prey. She survives due to her wits, ingenuity, and most of all, due to her falcon's loyalty

StatsPanel_MainStats_HealthRegen_Descrip: Points of Health regenerated per second
StatsPanel_MainStats_ManaRegen_Descripti: Points of mana regenerated per second
StatsPanel_Attributes_Strength_Descripti: Each point of strength increases armor by 4% and improves skills that rely the raw strength of you and your companions
StatsPanel_Attributes_Dexterity_Descript: Each point of dexterity adds 4 dodge rating and improves skills that rely on the skillful handling of weapons
StatsPanel_Attributes_Intelligence_Descr: Each point of intelligence grants 4% ward retention and improves skills that rely on carefully studied magic
StatsPanel_Attributes_Attunement_Descrip: Each point of attunement grants 2 mana and improves skills that rely on the innate magic inside you and your surroundings
StatsPanel_Attributes_Vitality_Descripti: Each point of vitality grants 6 Health and 1% poison and necrotic resistance
StatsPanel_Attributes_Experience_Descrip: Gained to level up your character
StatsPanel_Resistances_Physical_Descript:
Reduces physical damage taken. Capped at 75%.

Enemies penetrate 1% resistance per area level, up to 75%. This penetration applies after the resistance cap, so extra resistance above 75% has no effect unless enemies shred your resistance.

Resistance can be brought below 0% causing you to take increased damage.
StatsPanel_Resistances_Lightning_Descrip:
Reduces lightning damage taken. Capped at 75%.

Enemies penetrate 1% resistance per area level, up to 75%. This penetration applies after the resistance cap, so extra resistance above 75% has no effect unless enemies shred your resistance.

Resistance can be brought below 0% causing you to take increased damage.
StatsPanel_Resistances_Cold_Description:

Enemies penetrate 1% resistance per area level, up to 75%. This penetration applies after the resistance cap, so extra resistance above 75% has no effect unless enemies shred your resistance.

Resistance can be brought below 0% causing you to take increased damage.

StatsPanel_Resistances_Void_Description:

StatsPanel_Resistances_Necrotic_Descript:

StatsPanel_Resistances_Poison_Descriptio:

StatsPanel_Defenses_Block_Description: The chance that you'll block a hit from an attack or spell. When you block a hit you take reduced damage based on your block effectiveness.
StatsPanel_Defenses_Armour_Description:
Reduces damage taken from all hits, but not damage over time.

Armour is only 70% as effective against non-physical damage, mitigating [npam] of damage.
StatsPanel_Defenses_StunAvoidance_Descri:
Protects against stuns. When you take a hit you have a chance to be stunned equal to

Stun chance = 2 x (damage dealt / (max health + current ward)) - (500 + stun avoidance) / 5000

Due to the formula above, at 0% increased stun chance and 0 stun avoidance, non-player hits must deal more damage than 5% of a target's maximum health to have a chance to stun them. Every 100 stun avoidance raises this threshold by 1%.

When you are stunned, you become immune to stuns for 1 second after the stun ends.
StatsPanel_Defenses_BlockProtection_Desc:
The percentage by which damage is reduced when you block a hit.

Block mitigation is increased by block effectiveness, and reduced by the level of enemies in the area.
StatsPanel_Defenses_Dodge_Description:
Your chance to dodge a hit from enemies in this area.

Dodge chance is increased by dodge rating, and reduced by the level of enemies in the area.
StatsPanel_Defenses_Ward Retention_Descr:
Reduces the rate of ward decay. The formula for ward decay per second is

0.4 x current ward / (1 + 0.5 x ward retention)
StatsPanel_Defenses_PotionSlots_Descript:
Your maximum number of potions.

Potions are displayed next to your Health globe, and can be consumed to gain Health (by using the 1 key by default).
StatsPanel_DamageStats_CastSpeed_Descrip: Increases how quickly you can cast spells.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_MeleeAttackSpeed_:
Increases how quickly you can attack with melee attacks.

Takes into account your weapon's attack rate. A melee weapon with an attack rate of 1.2 effectively grants 20% more melee attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers).
StatsPanel_DamageStats_BowAttackSpeed_De:
Increases how quickly you can attack with bow attacks.

Takes into account your weapon's attack rate. A bow weapon with an attack rate of 1.2 effectively grants 20% more melee attack speed (multiplicative with other modifiers).
StatsPanel_DamageStats_ThrowingAttackSpe: Increases how quickly you can attack with throwing attacks.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_CriticalStrikeCha:
Chance to deal a critical strike with hits that do not have any skill specific crit modifiers.

The base critical strike chance is 5%.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_SpellCriticalStri: Chance to deal a critical strike with spell hits that do not have any other skill specific crit modifiers.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_MeleeCriticalStri: Chance to deal a critical strike with melee hits that do not have any other skill specific crit modifiers.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_BowCriticalStrike: Chance to deal a critical strike with bow hits that do not have any other skill specific crit modifiers.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_CriticalStrikeMul: Multiplies damage dealt by critical strikes.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_AreaOfEffectRadiu: Increasees area of affect radius for abilities tagged as Area of Affect
StatsPanel_DamageStats_ElementalDamage_D: Increases damage of abilities that deal fire, cold, and lightning damage
StatsPanel_DamageStats_BaseSpellDamagemo:
Increases the base damage of spells (multiplicative with increases from other sources)

Commonly found on the implicits of caster weapons such as wands
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedStunChan:
Increases the chance for a hit to stun an enemy.

Stun chance = (2 x damage dealt x (1 + increased stun chance)) / (max health + current ward)) - (500 + stun avoidance) / 5000

When calculating stun chance using the formula above, melee damage dealt by players is multiplied by 3, and other damage dealt by players is multiplied by 2.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedMeleeStu:
Increases the chance for a melee hit to stun an enemy.

Stun chance = (2 x damage dealt x (1 + increased stun chance)) / (max health + current ward)) - (500 + stun avoidance) / 5000

When calculating stun chance using the formula above, melee damage dealt by players is multiplied by 3, and other damage dealt by players is multiplied by 2.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedDamageOv: Increases all damage over time dealt by you.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedMeleeDam: Increases damage dealt with melee attacks.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedBowDamag: Increases damage dealt with bow attacks.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedThrowing: Increases damage dealt with throwing attacks.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedPhysical: Increases the physical damage you deal.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedLightnin: Increases the lightning damage you deal.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedColdDama: Increases the cold damage you deal.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedFireDama: Increases the fire damage you deal.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedVoidDama: Increases the void damage you deal.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedNecrotic: Increases the necrotic damage you deal.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedPoisonDa: Increases the poison damage you deal.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_IncreasedMinionDa: Increases all damage dealt by the minions you summon. Minions are not affected by generic damage increases.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_Tenacity_Descript: Protects against stuns. All hits have a chance to stun you based on the damage they deal divided by the sum of your Health plus tenacity.
StatsPanel_DamageStats_BlockChance_Descr: Blocking adds your block armour and your block elemental protection to your armour and elemental protection
StatsPanel_DamageStats_BasicAttackDPS_De: The damage per second you deal when repeatedly using basic attack.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_BlockArmour_Desc:
Block armour (along with your block protection) is added to your armour for hits that you block.

So your effective Health against physical damage from hits that you block is the sum of your Health, armour, block protection, and block armour.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_Endurance_Descri:
Endurance reduces the damage dealt to your Health below your Endurance Threshold.

For example if you have 50% Endurance and an Endurance Threshold of 100, all damage dealt to your last 100 Health will be reduced by 50%.

Endurance is capped at 60%.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_EnduranceThresho:
Endurance reduces the damage dealt to your Health below your Endurance Threshold.

For example if you have 50% Endurance and an Endurance Threshold of 100, all damage dealt to your last 100 Health will be reduced by 50%.

You have a base Endurance Threshold of 20% of your maximum Health.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_CriticalStrikeAv:
Gives a chance to downgrade an enemy's crit on you to a regular hit.

If you have 20% critical strike avoidance then 20% of crits against you will be downgraded to regular hits.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_GlancingBlowChan: Chance To Receive A Glancing Blow
Grants a chance to only receive a glancing blow when you take a hit. You take 35% less damage from glancing blows.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_BlockLightning_D:
The percentage of lightning damage mitigated when you block.

Block effectiveness is added to your lightning protection for hits that you block. So your effective Health against lightning damage from hits that you block is the sum of your Health, lightning protection, and block effectiveness.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_BlockCold_Descri:
The percentage of cold damage mitigated when you block.

Block effectivenessis added to your cold protection for hits that you block. So your effective Health against cold damage from hits that you block is the sum of your Health, cold protection, and block effectiveness.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_BlockFire_Descri:
The percentage of fire damage mitigated when you block.

Block effectiveness is added to your fire protection for hits that you block. So your effective Health against fire damage from hits that you block is the sum of your Health, fire protection, and block effectiveness.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_BlockVoid_Descri:
The percentage of void damage mitigated when you block.

Block effectiveness is added to your void protection for hits that you block. So your effective Health against void damage from hits that you block is the sum of your Health, void protection, and block effectiveness.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_BlockNecrotic_De:
The percentage of necrotic damage mitigated when you block.

Block effectiveness is added to your necrotic protection for hits that you block. So your effective Health against necrotic damage from hits that you block is the sum of your Health, necrotic protection, and block effectiveness.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_Thorns_Descripti:
Damage dealt directly to attackers when you are hit.

Ignores the attackers' defenses.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_Reflection_Descr:
Reflects a percentage of the damage you take.

You still take the damage that you reflect.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_DamageDealtToMan: Damage Dealt to Mana Before Health

Causes a percentage of the damage you take to be dealt to your mana instead of your Health.

Each point of mana shields 5 Health. So if 100 damage is dealt to your mana you only lose 20 mana.
Damage Dealt to Mana Before Ward
Damage Dealt to Mana Before Ward or Health

Causes a percentage of the damage you take to be dealt to your mana instead of your Health or ward.

Each point of mana shields 5 Health. So if 100 damage is dealt to your mana you only lose 20 mana.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_BlockPoison_Desc:
The percentage of poison damage mitigated when you block.

Block protection is added to your void protection for hits that you block. So your effective Health against void damage from hits that you block is the sum of your Health, void protection, and block protection.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_MinionHealth_Des: Increases the Health of your summoned minions.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_MinionHealthRege: Increases the Health regen of your summoned minions.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_MinionDodge_Desc: Gives your minions a chance to dodge.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_HealthOnHit_Desc: Health gained instantly on any hit (including spells).
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_HealthOnMeleeHit: Health gained instantly on melee hit.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_HealthOnKill_Des: Health gained instantly on any kill.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_HealthOnBlock_De: Health gained instantly when you block a hit.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_Leech_Descriptio: A percent of the damage you deal is returned to you as Health over three seconds.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_HitLeech_Label: Damage Leeched As Health On Hit
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_HitLeech_Descrip: A percent of the damage you deal with hits is returned to you as Health over three seconds.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_MeleeLeech_Descr: A percent of the melee damage you deal is returned to you as Health over three seconds.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_SpellLeech_Descr: A percent of the spell damage you deal is returned to you as Health over three seconds.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionDamage_Desc: Increases all damage dealt by the minions you summon. Minions are not affected by generic damage increases.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionCastSpeed_D: Increases how quickly your minions can cast spells.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionMeleeAttack: Increases how quickly your minions can attack with melee attacks.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionSpellDamage: Increases the damage your minions deal with spells.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionMeleeDamage: Increases the damage your minions deal with melee attacks.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionPhysicalDam: Increases the physical damage your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionLightningDa: Increases the lightning damage your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionColdDamage_: Increases the cold damage your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionFireDamage_: Increases the fire damage your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionVoidDamage_: Increases the void damage your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionNecroticDam: Increases the necrotic damage your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionPoisonDamag: Increases the poison damage your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionDamageOverT: Increases the damage over time your minions deal.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionHealth_Desc: Increases the Health of your summoned minions.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionHealthRegen: Increases the Health regen of your summoned minions.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionDodgeRating: Gives your minions a chance to dodge.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionCriticalStr:
Chance for your minions to deal a critical strike with hits that do not have any skill specific crit modifiers.

The base critical strike chance is 5%.
Multiplies damage dealt by your minions' critical strikes.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MinionPowerFromLe:
From level 26 onwards you gain 0.6% minion power per character level.

Minion power increases the damage your minions deal and reduces the damage they take. Both of these effects are multiplicative with other modifiers.

This means that at level 100 your minions deal 45% more damage and take 45% less damage.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_MaximumCompanions: Maximum companions that you can have summoned simultaneously.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_CompanionReviveSp: Increases the speed at which you revive downed companions.
StatsPanel_MinionStats_CompanionReviveRa: Increases the range at which you can revive downed companions.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_BleedChance_Descri:
Chance to inflict bleed on hit.

Bleed deals physical damage over time. An enemy can have multiple stacks of bleed at once.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks with each hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_BleedDamage_Descri:
The damage bleed deals over its 3 second duration.

Bleed deals physical damage over time. An enemy can have multiple stacks of bleed at once.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_PoisonChance_Descr:
Chance to poison on hit.

Poison deals poison damage over time, and the first 30 stacks on a target reduce poison resistance by 5% (2% against bosses and players). An enemy can have multiple stacks of poison at once.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks with each hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_PoisonDamage_Descr:
The damage poison deals over its 3 second duration.

Poison deals poison damage over time, and the first 30 stacks on a target reduce poison resistance by 5% (2% against bosses and players). An enemy can have multiple stacks of poison at once.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_IgniteChance_Descr:
Chance to ignite on hit.

Ignite deals fire damage over time. An enemy can have multiple stacks of ignite at once.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks with each hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_IgniteDamage_Descr:
The damage ignite deals over its 2.5 second duration.

Ignite deals fire damage over time. An enemy can have multiple stacks of ignite at once.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_IncreasedShockEffe:
Each stack of Shock reduces lightning resistance by 5% and increases chance to be stunned by 10% by default.

Increased shock effect increases the power of these debuffs. For example if you had 20% increased shock effect then each stack of shock would reduce lightning resistance by 6% and increase chance to be stunned by 12%.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_FrostbiteChance_De:
Chance to inflict Frostbite on hit.

Frostbite deals cold damage over time, and the first 30 stacks each increase chance to be frozen by 20%. An enemy can have multiple stacks of frostbite at once.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks with each hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_FrostbiteDamage_De:
The damage frostbite deals over its 3 second duration.

Frostbite deals cold damage over time, and the first 30 stacks each increase chance to be frozen by 20%. An enemy can have multiple stacks of frostbite at once.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_ChillChance_Descri:
Chance to chill on hit.

Chill reduces attack speed, cast speed, and movement speed by 12% (6% against players), and stacks up to 3 times.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks with each hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_SlowChance_Descrip:
Chance to inflict slow on hit.

Slow reduces movement speed by 20% (10% against players) and stacks up to 3 times.


Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks with each hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_ShockChance_Descri:
Chance to inflict shock on hit.

Each stack of Shock reduces lightning resistance by 5% and increases chance to be stunned by 10% for 4 seconds. Has 60% less effect against bosses and players. An Enemy can have up to 10 stacks of shock at once.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks with each hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_BindChance_Descrip:
Chance to blind on hit.

Blind halves crit chance and causes enemies to aim eratically, often missing ranged attacks.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_FreezeRateMultipli: Cold skills have a chance to freeze on hit equal to their freeze rate divided by the target's Health.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_PotionSlots_Descri:
Your maximum number of potions.

Potions are displayed next to your Health globe, and can be consumed to gain Health (by using the 1 key by default).
StatsPanel_OtherStats_PotionHealth_Descr:
Press 1 to consume a potion to recover Health.

The base amount healed is 50 plus 4 times your characer level.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_PotionDropRate_Des:
Increases your chance to find potions. Potions are rarely found when you already have your maximum number of potions.

Potions are displayed next to your Health globe, and can be consumed to gain Health (by using the 1 key by default).
StatsPanel_OtherStats_ManaEfficiency_Des:
Mana efficiency increases how efficient your mana usage is.

Mana cost = base mana cost / (1 + mana efficiency)
StatsPanel_OtherStats_ChillRetaliationCh:
Chance to chill enemies when they hit you.

Chill reduces attack speed, cast speed, and movement speed by 12% (6% against players), and stacks up to 3 times.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks when hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_SlowRetaliationCha:
Chance to slow attackers when they hit you.

Slow reduces movement speed by 20% (10% against players) and stacks up to 3 times.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks when hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_ShockRetaliationCh:
Chance to shock attackers when they hit you.

Each stack of Shock reduces lightning resistance by 5% and increases chance to be stunned by 10% for 4 seconds. Has 60% less effect against bosses and players. An Enemy can have up to 10 stacks of shock at once.

Chance above 100% gives a chance to apply multiple stacks when hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_IncreasedHealingEf:
Increases the amount healed by your healing skills.

Does not affect Health gained from other sources such as potions, Health regen, leech, or Health gained on hit.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_IncreasedCooldownR:
Increases the speed at which your cooldowns recover.

If you have 100% increased cooldown recovery speed your cooldowns recovery twice as quickly, so an 8 second cooldown would become a 4 second cooldown.
StatsPanel_OtherStats_UniquesPickedUp_De: The total number of unique items you have picked up.
Crafting_Panel_Glyph_Sealed: Glyph of Despair sealed {0} at tier
Crafting_Panel_Glyph_CriticalSuccess: Critical Success preserved Forging Potential and Crafting Materials
Crafting_Panel_Glyph_Hope: Glyph of Hope preserved Forging Potential
Crafting_ForgeButton_Title_UnsupportedMo: Item type does not support mod
Crafting_Panel_HelpWindow_CraftingShards:
Each shard represents one tier of an affix, and can be crafted onto another item to upgrade that affix by one tier.

For example, to add a new tier 5 (maxed out) affix to an item, five shards of the appropriate type must be added.
Crafting_Panel_HelpWindow_ShatteringItem: When an item is shattered using a <color=#B38269>Rune of Shattering</color>, it is converted into shards. The amount of shards given is random, but can be as high as one shard for each tier of affix on an item. This means that an item with four tier 5 affixes could yield up to 20 affix shards (5 of each type). However, it will very likely yield less than that.
Crafting_Panel_HelpWindow_ForgingPotenti:
All normal, magic, rare and exalted items spawn with a random amount of Forging Potential.

Most crafting actions consume a random amount of Forging Potential. Once an item has zero Forging Potential, it cannot be crafted on anymore (other than Shattering).
Crafting_Panel_HelpWindow_CraftingWithSh:
Every shard upgrades its respective affix by one tier when applied to an item, but items can have a maximum of four affixes and each affix has five tiers.


Using a shard costs Forging Potential, unless a critical success occurs. A critical success upgrades the tier of an affix on the item by one in addition to the normal outcome of the shard. It does not cost any crafting materials or Forging Potential, and cannot upgrade affixes above tier 5.
Crafting_Panel_HelpWindow_RunesAndGlyphs:
Runes can be used as the main crafting item instead of shards, modifying the item in different ways.

Glyphs can be used in crafts as supporting items for Runes and Shards, impacting the outcome of the craft.

For a list of Runes and Glyphs, check the Game Guide [G].
SkillTree_Tooltip_Specialization_Content: As you level up you will unlock five specialization slots. Each one can be used to specialise in a skill.
SkillTree_Unlocks_SpendingPointIntoTree: Unlocked by spending points in the {0} passive tree.
SkillTree_ConfirmUnallocation_Explanatio:
Unallocating a skill augment point will reduce the level of your skill and reduce your maximum number of allocatable points by 1.

You will be able to re-level your skill to regain points up to 20.
SkillTree_ConfirmDespecialize_Explanatio: Despecializing will remove all skill points and experience from this skill, and allow you to specialize in another skill in its place. The new skill will start at your minimum skill level.
SkillTree_ConfirmRespec_Explanation:
Respeccing a point from a node will reduce the skill's level by 1 if it is above your minimum skill level.

If this would reduce the skill to a lower level than your minimum skill level, you can reallocate that point immediately. Otherwise, you can level it back up to regain the point.
SkillTree_FirstVisitTooltip_Explanation:
Click on a Skill


Click on an action bar slot to access the skill selection panel


You can specialize in up to five skills by clicking an unlocked specialization slot located above which unlock as you level up. Specializing in a skill will allow you to gain skill points for that skill by earning experience which you can use to empower and augment it.

Note: Some skills do not have an augment tree avilable yet.
MinimumSkillLevel_Tooltip_Description:
Minimum Skill Level dictates how many skill points your skills start with when you specialize in them and how many skill points will be retained
when de-leveling a skill.
(You may delevel a skill if you want to change your skill tree allocations.)



As you level up your Minimum Skill Level will also increase periodically.
SkillTree_SkillLevelTooltip_Level0_Skill: You have not specialised in this ability, so you cannot put points in its tree
You have not unlocked this ability, so you cannot put points in its tree
Map_Panel_QuickTravel_Description: Would you like to return to your previous time and location?
Ward_Retention:
ward retention
<#9B9383>Reduces the rate of Ward decay.
Endurance_Threshold:
endurance threshold
<#9B9383><size="11"><font="Forum-Regular SDF">Endurance is active below this

Keyword_Tooltip_Health: When <#FF7E7E>Health</color> reaches 0, your character is dead.
Keyword_Tooltip_Ward: <#83D3FF>Ward</color> absorbs damage before Health, has no cap, and decays over time. Decay occurs more quickly the more Ward you have.
Keyword_Tooltip_Endurance: <#FFDB7E>Endurance</color> reduces damage dealt to your Health below your Endurance Threshold. Does not reduce damage dealt to Ward.
PurchaseTab_Description:
This will add an additional configurable stash tab.
Right click on a stash tab to configure it.
Shop_Panel_Instructions_Label: <color=#fff>[ Shift +       ]</color> an item to buy or sell

Respeccing one point from this node costs {cost} gold.

(you currently have {gold} gold)
PassiveTree_Panel_CannotRespec_Explanati:
Respeccing one point from this node costs {cost} gold.

(you currently have {gold} gold)
PassiveTree_Panel_FirstVisitTooltip_Expl:
<color=#E0A86D><font=Cinzel-Regular SDF><size=14>gaining passive node points</color></font>
Gain passive points by leveling up and completing quests. Advancing your passive trees will unlock new skills and passives.

<color=#E0A86D><font=Cinzel-Regular SDF><size=14>mastery classes</color></font></color>
Initially, you may only place points in your base class tree. You will have the opportunity to choose a Mastery Class during your adventure.

Once you choose a Mastery Class you will gain access to the left section of each Mastery, and the right section of your chosen Mastery. You may only select one Mastery per character.
PassiveTree_Panel_SorcererBonus2_Label: Spells deal increased damage equal to their mana cost
PassiveTree_Panel_SpellbladeBonus2_Label: Mana spent on melee attacks is converted to ward
PassiveTree_Panel_VoidKnightBonus2_Label: Your melee attacks, throwing attacks and void spells have a 10% chance to be repeated by an echo 0.5s later (excludes movement abilities and Anomaly).
PassiveTree_Panel_ForgeGuardBonus2_Label: 3% increased armor for each hit you have taken in the last 10 seconds
PassiveTree_Panel_PaladinBonus1_Label: You deal increased fire, lightning, and physical damage equal to your percent Health remaining.
PassiveTree_Panel_PaladinBonus2_Label: 1% increased healing effectiveness per point of attunement
PassiveTree_Panel_LichBonus1_Label: 1% of damage dealt is leeched as Health
PassiveTree_Panel_LichBonus2_Label: Spells and Melee attacks deal increased damage equal to your missing Health
PassiveTree_Panel_BeastmasterBonus2_Labe: You and your minions deal 50% increased melee damage
PassiveTree_Panel_ShamanBonus3_Label: +50% elemental resistance while you control a totem
PassiveTree_Panel_DruidBonus1_Label: When leaving a transformed state, you gain 70% damage reduction for 2 seconds
PassiveTree_Panel_BladedancerBonus3_Labe: 15% more dodge rating (multiplicative with other modifiers)
PassiveTree_Panel_MarksmanBonus1_Label: Using a bow attack grants 5% increased attack speed. Can stack 5 times. All stacks fall off after if you have not used a bow attack recently.
PassiveTree_Panel_MarksmanBonus2_Label: 50% increased damage while using a bow.
Class_Sentinel_Description: A former soldier of Rahyeh’s army who left their ranks to pursue a more noble path.
Class_Mage_Description: An Elder cresting his prime, the Mage wields the power of the arcane to make up for his past wrongs and to give the world a new future.
Class_Primalist_Description: A warrior from the north who has seen the horrors of war first hand, the Primalist seeks communion with the power of Eterra, the power of the earth.
Class_Rogue_Description: Unrivaled in bow and blade, the rogue strikes out from the shadows to find a higher purpose for her deadly talents.
Class_Acolyte_Description: A rebellious scion who disobeyed her masters to seek out forbidden magic, the Acolyte will let nothing stop her from becoming more powerful.
Mastery_VoidKnight_Description: A fallen knight who has taken part of the void inside themselves and uses it to devastate their foes even at the cost of their own life.
Mastery_Forge_Guard_Description: A bulwark of strength and steel whose mastery of weapons, armor, and the animation of molten metal dominates the battlefield.
Mastery_Paladin_Description: You are a righteous warrior, your conviction empowering your allies and burning away the dark with righteous fire.
Mastery_Necromancer_Description: A commander of undeath, they send their animated thralls to battle perfectly willing to sacrifice them as they deem fit.
Mastery_Lich_Description: An acolyte who embraces the corruption of their power and uses the magic of blood and death even at the expense of their own Health.
Mastery_Warlock_Description: A master of the forbidden arts, they tear into the essence of their foes, corrupting their spirits with relentless curses, necrotic magic and flames to burn their flesh.
Mastery_Sorcerer_Description: A master of the arcane who wields unprecedented power to devastate their foes from a distance.
Mastery_Spellblade_Description: A mage who has mixed martial prowess and cunning with their mastery of spells to face enemies in close range.
Mastery_Runemaster_Description: An Elder cresting his prime, the Mage wields the power of the arcane to make up for his past wrongs and to give the world a new future.
Mastery_Shaman_Description: Your strikes bear power, avalanches that shatter mountainsides, the lightning that cracks the sky open. You are the storm.
Mastery_Druid_Description: You are the avatar of the latent power of the earth. Your form malleable to that power, Eterra's bastion against all that would threaten her.
Mastery_Beastmaster_Description: You are the master of the wilds and the beasts that dwell within. The heart of the wild beats within you, its fury leading your way.
Mastery_Bladedancer_Description: An artisan of shadows, they dash in and out of the reach of their enemies, each movement another deadly cut.
Mastery_Marksman_Description: A master of the bow, adept at engaging foes from a distance and keeping them there.
Mastery_Falconer_Description: A master tactician who employs deceptive traps and a fearsome bird of prey to gain an advantage against her enemies.
RespecPanel_Despecialize_Explanation: Despecializing will remove all skill points and experience from this skill, and allow you to specialize in another skill in its place. The new skill will start at your minimum skill level.
RespecPanel_RemoveSkill_Explanation: Remove spent points of your choosing in this skill tree. Each point removed will <color=#ff5555>reduce the skill's level by 1</color> if above your minimum skill level. Level up the skill as normal to spend these points again.

MonolithPanel_Reroll_Explanation: Rerolling will make your next Monolith level have a random mod with 30% increased power.
MonolithPanel_Reset_Title: Are you sure you want to reset?
MonolithPanel_Reset_Explanation: This will clear all current progress in this Timeline, resetting your Echoes Conquered to 0.
MonolithPanel_Tooltip_Explanation:
As you conquer echos you will encounter Quest Echos which will lead to the climax of the Timeline. Defeat all the Quest Echos to conquer the Timeline.

You can learn more about the Monolith of Fate by visiting the in-game guide [G]
MonolithPanel_Rewards_Explanation: In this Timeline echoes can have rewards that grant unique or set melee weapons (swords, axes, maces, daggers, or polearms)
MonolithPanel_Depth_Explanation: You have unlocked a legendary version of this timeline. You may choose that version or the normal version at the start of each run.
MonolithPanel_EchoText_MinimumEcho: Minimum echoes conquered for chance of finding next Quest Echo: <color=#ffffff>
MonolithPanel_EchoText_ChanceOfEncounter: Chance of encountering next Quest Echo with
MonolithPanel_CorruptionIncreases_Label:
Corruption increases monster Health and damage
Corruption increases item rarity and experience gained
MonolithPanel_CorruptionEchoRarity_Label: <color=#B2A57A><b>Corruption also increases rarity of Echo Rewards
MonolithTimeLinePanel_Corruption_Explana:
Your actions within this timeline have drawn the attention of Orobyss. The threats you face have grown in power as the Void draws closer.

Corruption is changed by defeating the Shade of Orobyss. Defeating a Shade far from the center of the timeline increases corruption, while defeating a Shade closer may reduce it.
MonolithTimeLinePanel_EchoInformation_Ex: Completing this Echo resets the timeline. Existing modifiers will remain.
MonolithTimeLinePanel_EchoInformation_Ec: Rewards can only be claimed if you do not die in this echo
MonolithTimeLinePanel_Stability_Tooltip:
Your exploration of the echoes have restored and stabilized parts of this destroyed timeline. With enough stability you will be able to enter quest echoes, key moments in this timeline's history.


Stability is gained by successfully exploring the echoes within the timeline and extending your echo web. Some echoes provide more stability than others.
MonolithTimeLinePanel_TimelineQuest_Tool: You've unlocked a Timeline Quest. Click here to view the quest to progress in this Timeline.
MonolithTimeLinePanel_RewardText_RewardC: >Rewards can only be claimed if you do not die in this echo
MonolithTimeLinePanel_RewardText_Stabili: >Stability reward can only be claimed if you do not die in this echo
MonolithTimeLinePanel_CreateReward_Rewar: Rewards Lost from Dying in Echo
MonolithTimeLinePanel_EchoInformation_Sh: Completing this echo resets this timeline's web of echoes. However the stability, active modifiers, and quest echo progress persist.
MonolithTimeLinePanel_EchoInformation_Bo: bonus corruption because you have another empowered timeline with higher corruption than this one.
Monolith_BonusText_CorruptionIsHigher: Bonus corruption is higher when there is a greater difference in timeline corruption and the echo is further from the origin
Monolith_BonusText_CompletingOrobyss: Completing this echo will consume all Gaze of Orobyss. Gaze of Orobyss is gained by completing the required quest echo.
Monolith_BonusText_CorruptionIncreasesTh: Corruption increases the damage and Health of enemies, but also the rarity of items they drop, and the rarity of echo specific rewards.
MonolithTimeLinePanel_EchoInformation_Be: Charge the Beacon in this echo to reveal echoes in a large area around it.
MonolithTimeLinePanel_EchoInformation_Ve: Destroy the Vessel of Chaos in this echo to reroll the rewards of all uncompleted echoes in this web.
Destroy the Vessel of Memory in this echo to restore completed echoes on this web to their original states.
allowing you to complete them again and claim their rewards for a second time.
Echoes containing Vessels of Memory or Vessels of Chaos are unaffected.
BottomScreenUI_PortalTooltip_Body: Opens a portal back to the last major town you visited.
BottomScreenUI_PortalTooltip_Locked_Body:
Once you unlock this by visiting the Council Chambers, you'll be able to open a
portal back to the last major town you visited.
BottomScreenUI_FlaskTooltip_Body:
Use to consume a potion which restores your Health.

The Health restored is equal to 50 + 5 x character level (i.e. 55 at level 1 and 550 at level 100)

Slain enemies have a chance to drop potions which you can pick up.

You can attempt to conquer timelines at a higher difficulty
MasteryTreeUnlockedNotification_Details_: You may now put passive points into mastery trees

Tutorials_LootFilter_Text: You can hide unwanted items on the ground by setting up a Loot Filter. Check it out by pressing [Shift+F] or opening the Loot Filter screen through the Settings menu.

VaultOfFate_Panel_Help_Tooltip_Explanati:
Derium will offer you a series of choices which affect the rewards within the Vault.

Each choice increases the gold cost of subsequent offers. Choose carefully.
VaultOfFate_Panel_Closing_Explanation:
Closing this panel will NOT refund
the gold invested.

If you leave the zone without opening the vault the gold will be lost with no rewards.
VaultOfFate_Panel_Help_Tooltip_Descripti:
Derium will offer you a series of choices which affect the rewards within the Vault.

The cost of accepting an offer depends on the modifiers already chosen.

Declining an offer increases the cost of the modifier you are offered in its stead.

Choose carefully.
EternityCach_Panel_Past_Description: Seal a <#EF9728>Unique</color> item with Legendary Potential and an <#C686FF>Exalted</color> item with 4 affixes. Each item must be of the same type.
EternityCach_Panel_Past_ExaltedItem_Tool:
Affixes from this <#C686FF>Exalted item will be randomly extracted by the Eternity Cache and added to the Unique item, forging a Legendary item.

The number of random affixes extracted is determined by the Legendary Potential of the Unique item. For example, a Unique item with 1 Legendary Potential will gain 1 random affix from the Exalted item.

The Exalted item must have exactly 4 unsealed affixes.
EternityCach_Panel_Past_UniqueItem_Toolt:
Place a <#EF9728>Unique item with Legendary Potential here. Legendary Potential determines the number of affixes which will be randomly extracted from the Exalted item and added to this item, forging a Legendary item in the process.

The item must have a level requirement of [x] or below.
EternityCach_Panel_Past_UniqueItem_Error:
This slot requires a Unique item with Legendary Potential to be used in the Eternity Cache.

The item must have level requirement of [x] or below.
EternityCach_Panel_Past_ExaltedItem_Erro: This slot requires an <color=#C686FF>Exalted</color> item which must have exactly 4 unsealed affixes to be used in the Eternity Cache.
EternityCach_Panel_FutureRuined_Descript: Time proves the most potent forge.

EternityCach_Panel_ClosedDivine_Descript: The empty cache hums with lost potential that will never be found in this era.
EternityCach_Panel_ClosedDivine_Tooltip_: Use the Epoch's power to return to the Eternity Cache in the Ruined era.
EternityCach_Panel_ClosedRuined_Descript: Ancient power weaves around the contents within. The synthesis will be complete in time.
EternityCach_Panel_ClosedRuined_Tooltip_: Return to the Eternity Cache in the Divine Era to harness its power.

MasteryPanel_Warlock_Description: A master of the forbidden arts, they tear into the essence of their foes, corrupting their spirits with relentless curses and hexes.
MasteryPanel_Runemaster_Description: A savant of the art of runes, able to infuse magic into offensive and protective wards that devastate those who trespass them.
MasteryPanel_Druid_Description: You are the avatar of the latent power of the earth, your form malleable to that power, Eterra’s bastion against all that would threaten her.
MasteryPanel_Paladin_Description: A righteous warrior focused on empowering and healing their allies who can take down swaths of enemies with holy fire.
MasteryPanel_Falconer_Description: A master tactician who employs deceptive traps and a fearsome bird of prey to gain an advantage against her enemies.
MasteryPanel_MasterySelected_Explanation: You have already selected your mastery bonus and cannot select a new one.
MasteryPanel_MasteryChoosing_Explanation: Choosing a <color=#C89257>Mastery Class </color>is final and <u>can not be undone or changed.
ChooseBlessingPanel_Tutorial_Text: Completing a <#F2EEE2>Timeline</color> in the <#F2EEE2>Monolith</color> lets you choose one of several randomized <#F2EEE2>Blessings</color> from its unique pool. The power roll is selected at random, and the Blessing persists on your character both in and out of the Monolith.
Loading_Tip_1: Dodge rating gives you a chance to dodge any hit, but not damage over time. The chance is lower against enemies in higher level areas.
Loading_Tip_2: Armour reduces the damage you take from all hits, but not damage over time. It's 70% effective against non-physical damage. The amount of damage mitigation depends on area level.
Loading_Tip_3: Eterra is the embodiment of the world itself and guardian of all who dwell there. She is the mother of the other gods and all living things.
Loading_Tip_4: The Temple of Eterra rises high above the lush world below, connected only by massive chains.
Loading_Tip_5: Heorot is the god of the north, master of the tundra wanderers. His divine breath rises to the sky to form the aurora.
Loading_Tip_6: Lagon is the god of the west, master of the sea and its storms. His great eye reflects the light of the moon.
Loading_Tip_7: Majasa is the goddess of the south, mistress of the desert. The sand that has been blessed by her scales is dusted across the night sky, forming the stars.
Loading_Tip_8: Rahyeh is the god of the east, master of the mountains. His flaming crest burns with the light of the sun.
Loading_Tip_9: Only minion damage increases the damage dealt by your totems, companions, and other minions.
Loading_Tip_10: Only minion damage increases the damage dealt by your minions.
Loading_Tip_11: By default only minion damage increases the damage dealt by your minions.
Loading_Tip_12: Ward is a temporary shield that protects your Health, but decays over time. Ward retention slows this decay.
Loading_Tip_13: Rahyeh surveys his domain atop the highest peak of the eastern mountains. No transgression of his followers escaping his gaze, the punishment for such is swift and unforgiving.
Loading_Tip_14: The god of the east, Rahyeh, takes the form of a glorious eagle, fire raging from his golden feathers, his talons formed of black molten glass.
Loading_Tip_15: The goddess of the south, Majasa, takes the form of a colossal serpent that dwells underneath the sand of the desert, jewels encrusting her body, the gems of her cobra-esque hood gleaming like a crown.
Loading_Tip_16: The god of the north, Heorot, takes the form of a massive white elk, his mane forever frozen over with the purest crystals of ice.
Loading_Tip_17: The god of the Western Sea, Lagon, takes the form of a sea giant, with scales covering his body, and great webbed claws at the end of arms coated in sharp coral.
Loading_Tip_18: The Immortal Empire has spread across Eterra, liberating the living from their mortal lives and constructing infernal devices powered by their souls.
Loading_Tip_19: The rank and file of the undead empire are mindless ghosts and skeletons, but the necromancers still retain all the cunning and cruelty they possessed when mortal.
Loading_Tip_20: Minion Commands: Pressing A will command your minions to attack the target or run to the target location.
Loading_Tip_21: Minion Commands: Pressing A will command your minions to attack the target or run to the target location.
Loading_Tip_22: Increased Elemental Damage affects fire, cold, and lightning damage.
Loading_Tip_23: Health leech also applies to damage over time, unless "on hit" is specified.
Loading_Tip_24: Critical strike chance has no effect for damage over time.
Loading_Tip_25: Damaging ailments like ignite, bleed, and poison have a fixed base damage, which does not change based on the hit that applied them.
Loading_Tip_26: If you are already holding your maximum number of potions picking up another potion will use it automatically.
Loading_Tip_27: Most cold skills have a freeze rate, which gives them a chance to freeze on hit. This chance is not affected by damage, but is lower against enemies with higher Health.
Loading_Tip_28: Minions take 50% less damage from all sources.
Loading_Tip_29: Blood spells and the bleed ailment deal physical damage.
Loading_Tip_30: Player abilities are 100% more likely to stun on hit than enemy or minion abilities. For melee attacks this bonus is doubled to 200%.
Loading_Tip_31: You can view active and previous quests in the map window (M by default).
Loading_Tip_32: In the Monolith of Fate, the number of items in the reward chest depends on the number of enemies you killed in the previous timeline.
Loading_Tip_33: Armour Shred reduces the armour of all enemies, even those without base armour, increasing the damage they take from all hits.
Loading_Tip_34: Choosing your mastery in the End of Time unlocks the full passive tree for that mastery, and also the left halves of the other mastery trees.
Loading_Tip_35: You can use affix shards to upgrade the affixes on your items.
Loading_Tip_36: Press the Transfer Crafting Items button in the Inventory to transfer shards, glyphs, and runes to the forge so they can be used for crafting.
Loading_Tip_37: You can improve items using your shards and runes at any time by opening the Forge (F by default)
Loading_Tip_38: G opens the Game Guide, which has details on many game mechanics.
Loading_Tip_39: Resistances cap at 75%. Having more than 75% Resistance does not directly reduce the damage you take any further.
Loading_Tip_40: Penetration applies after Resistances are capped at 75%. Penetration causes more damage to be dealt even if the target has no Resistances.
Loading_Tip_41: Resistance Shred ailments reduce your Resistances before the 75% cap is applied. Having more than 75% Resistance protects against them.
Loading_Tip_42: Enemies have 1% penetration per area level for each damage type, up to a maximum of 75%.
Loading_Tip_43: Resistances can be brought to negative values, increasing damage taken.

Loading_Tip_44: Rare enemies always drop a rare item.
Loading_Tip_45: Base critical strike chance is always 5%, except for damage over time, which cannot crit.
Loading_Tip_46: Holding X temporarily shows items hidden by the loot filter.
Loading_Tip_47: Press Shift and F at the same time to open the loot filter menu.
Loading_Tip_48: You can rebind your keybinds in the Settings menu, accessed by pressing O.
Loading_Tip_49: Once you have chosen your mastery, you can also access the first half of your base class's other masteries' passive trees and unlock the skills inside.
Loading_Tip_50: In the Monolith Echoes further from the origin grant more stability and have better rewards on average.
Loading_Tip_51: In Empowered Timelines Timeline Bosses have a higher chance of dropping their rarer specific drops, and some of their specific drops only drop in Empowered Timelines.
Loading_Tip_52: To unlock Empowered Timelines you must unlock and complete each level 90 timeline then go to the conduit between them in the Monolith of Fate.
Loading_Tip_53: Dungeons keys can be offered as rewards in Tier 4 arena runs.
Loading_Tip_54: All rare enemies have a chance to drop a dungeon key. This chance is higher at higher levels.
Loading_Tip_55: All rare enemies have a chance to drop a dungeon key. This chance is higher at higher levels and at higher corruption in the Monolith.
Loading_Tip_56: The cooldown of most movement skills does not start until you finish using them.

StatsPanel_Defenses_Dodge_Rating_Descrip: Dodge Rating provides a chance to dodge. Higher level enemies are more accurate, so you have a lower dodge chance in higher level areas.
StatsPanel_DefenseStats_WardDecayThresho:
Ward does not decay below your Ward Decay Threshold and ward below the threshold does not contribute to decay rate.

For example if you have a Ward Decay Threshold of 500 then ward will not decay below 500 and ward decay rate at 1000 ward will be halved.

PassiveTree_Panel_Info_Explanation:
<color=#E0A86D><font=Cinzel-Regular SDF><size=14>gaining passive node points</color></font>
Gain passive points by leveling up and completing quests. Advancing your passive trees will unlock new skills and passives.

<color=#E0A86D><font=Cinzel-Regular SDF><size=14>mastery classes</color></font></color>
Initially, you may only place points in your base class tree. You will have the opportunity to choose a Mastery Class during your adventure.

Once you choose a Mastery Class you will gain access to the left section of each Mastery, and the right section of your chosen Mastery. You may only select one Mastery per character.
PassiveTree_Panel_FirstVisit_Explanation:
<color=#FDDCBC><font=Cinzel-Regular SDF><size=14>gaining passive node points</color></font>

<color=#FDDCBC><font=Cinzel-Regular SDF><size=14>mastery classes</color></font></color>
Currently you have access to your Base Class passives. You will have the opportunity to choose a Mastery Class during your adventure.

Once you choose a Mastery Class you will gain access to the left section of each Mastery, and the right section of your chosen Mastery.

Settings_SoloChallange_Abandon_Explanati:
If you abandon Solo Account Found challenge all items in your Solo Account Found shared stash will no longer be accessible by this character, as well as your gold and crafting materials. Instead this character will have access to your regular characters' shared stash, gold, and crafting materials.

You cannot re-enable the challenge once it has been disabled.

Abandoning a challenge will return you to character select for the changes to take effect.
Settngs_HideRequest_Explanation: Hides the popup for Party Requests from players not already on your friends list.

Enabled

Enabled

Challenge_SAF_Warning:
If you abandon Solo Account Found challenge all items in your Solo Account Found shared stash will no longer be accessible by this character, as well as your gold and crafting materials. Instead this character will have access to your regular characters' shared stash, gold, and crafting materials.

You cannot re-enable the challenge once it has been disabled.

Abandoning a challenge will return you to character select for the changes to take effect.
Challenge_CF_Warning:
If you abandon Character Found challenge all items in your stash will be lost, as well as your gold and crafting materials. Instead this character will have access to your shared stash, gold, and crafting materials.

You cannot re-enable the challenge once it has been disabled.

Abandoning a challenge will return you to character select for the changes to take effect.

SkillTree_Tooltip_Specialization_Content: When you specialize in a skill you gain access to its augment tree, which has nodes that enhance the skill.
Skills gain experience when you do and when a skill levels up you gain a point to spend in its tree.

If you want to change a skill's augments you may remove points from your skill tree by Respecializing. You will gain skill points back with experience gained. You will retain points to reinvest if you remove more augments than your <#E7E0AD>Minimum Skill Level</color>.

UI/Cycles/MigrationModal_Main: Your characters from Beta have been Migrated to Legacy. You can still access them at any time. At the start of each Cycle, your characters will be migrated to this realm.
Cycles/CyleDescription: Cycles offer a fresh start in a new environment. Leaderboards are reset.
Cycles/LegacyDescription: Legacy characters maintain access to all of your previous characters and their stashes. No leaderboards.
Cycles/CycleLengthNotice: Cycle characters are moved to the Legacy realm when the Cycle ends. Cycles typically last around 3-4 months.
Monolith_Corruption_Tooltip:
Corruption increases the health and damage of enemies in the timeline, experience gained, rarity of items found, and stability gained from completing echoes within the timeline.

Defeat Shades of Orobyss to increase Corruption further. To cleanse corruption visit the Sanctuary of Eterra close to the centre of the timeline.
Monolith_Gaze_of_Orobyss_Explanation:
Gain 1 Gaze of Orobyss when you defeat the boss in this quest echo.

Gaze of Orobyss will be consumed when fighting Shades of Orobyss to increase Corruption.  However, if you die while fighting such a shade, Gaze of Orobyss will be lost.
Monolith_Timeline_Instability_Explanatio:
Alternate Timelines are unstable.

Stabilize the timeline by completing objectives inside the Echoes of the Timeline.

Echoes further away from the Timeline entry point (here) are more unstable. Completing these will provide more stability, challenge, and rewards.
Monolith_Stability_Tooltip_Expalanation:
Your exploration of the echoes have further stabilized parts of this timeline. With enough stability you will be able to enter quest echoes, key moments in this timeline's history.

Stability is gained by successfully exploring the echoes within the timeline and extending your echo web. Some echoes provide more stability than others.

Faction_Tutorial_FavorRep_MG_Message:
While aligned with The Merchant Guild, you gain Favor when slaying enemies or completing quests.

Favor can be spent in the Bazaar to gain Reputation, which is your experience with a Faction. A small amount of Reputation is also gained when slaying enemies or completing quests.
Faction_Tutorial_RankRewards_MG_Message: As your Reputation grows you gain Ranks within the Merchant Guild, unlocking the full potential of the Bazaar. Each rank allows you to buy and sell increasingly powerful items.
Factions_Help_Favor: You gain Favor when slaying enemies or completing quests.
Factions_Help_SpendFavor: Spend Favor by trading to increase your Reputation and Rank, unlocking rewards. A small amount of Reputation is also gained while slaying enemies or completing quests.

Factions_Help_CoF_SpendFavor: Spend Favor in the Observatory to increase your Reputation and Rank, unlocking rewards. A small amount of Reputation is gained while slaying enemies or completing quests.
